profileText: A Representative from Missouri; born in Madison County, Mo., October 13, 1820; was graduated from Cumberland University, Lebanon, Tenn.; studied law; was admitted to the bar and commenced practice in Fredericktown, Madison County, Mo.; moved to Cape Girardeau, Mo., in 1844; held several local offices; elected as a Whig to the Thirty-third Congress; reelected as an Opposition Party candidate to the Thirty-fourth Congresses (March 4, 1853-March 3, 1857); and reelected as a Democrat to the Thirty-fifth Congress (March 4, 1857-March 3, 1859); died in Cape Girardeau, Cape Girardeau County, Mo., July 20, 1860.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Caruthers, Samuel. Election of speaker. [Washington: Printed at the office of the Congressional Globe, 1856].

------. Letter of Samuel Caruthers to his constituents, explaining his past action, defining his present position, and the position of parties. Washington: Printed at the Congressional Globe Office, 1856.
------. Remarks of Hon. S. Caruthers, of Mo., in the House of Representatives, January 9, 1856. [Washington: Printed at the Congressional Globe Office, 1856].

------. Speech of Hon. S. Caruthers, of Missouri, on the Nebraska and Kansas bill. Delivered in the House of Representatives, April 7, 1854. Washington: Printed at the Congressional Globe Office, 1854.

researchRecord.name: In the Joseph Bissonette Papers, 1855-1862, 10 items.
